text.p: Toshiba Corp's Toshiba America Information Systems Inc said it unveiled its Digital Video Disk Read-Only Memory (DVD-ROM) drive and expects to begin shipments in the U.S. in January 1997.
Toshiba said it expects customers to pay about $400 to $500 more for personal computers outfitted with DVD-ROM.
Toshiba said its SD-M1002 DVD-ROM Drive will be marketed primarily to equipment manufacturers, at a starting price of about $350 each, and systems integrators.
Initial sales will be made in a multi-media upgrade kit, to be marketed by Diamond Multimedia, starting next year.

The new Toshiba DVD device provides all digital video and audio playback with roughly eight times as much storage capacity as current CD-ROMs and is also compatible with current CD formats, including audio tracks.
They expect to produce a thin version for laptop computers by the third quarter of 1997.
